text: Robert Andrew Blust (May 9, 1940 - January 5, 2022) was an American linguist. His works were about historical linguistics, lexicography and ethnology. He was a Professor of Linguistics at the University of Hawaii at Mānoa. Blust's works were also about the Austronesian languages. Blust died of cancer on January 5, 2022 in Honolulu, Hawaii at the age of 81. ==References== Category:1940 births Category:2022 deaths Category:University of Hawaiʻi faculty Category:American linguists Category:Writers from Cincinnati Category:Educators from Honolulu Category:University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa alumni
